See also: hunger

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German hunger, from Old High German hungar, from Proto-Germanic *hungruz, from Proto-Indo-European *kenk- (“to burn, smart, desire, hunger, thirst”). Compare Low German Hunger, Dutch honger, English hunger, Swedish hunger

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈhʊŋɐ/
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Hunger m (genitive Hungers, no plural)

  1. hunger

Declension[edit]

Declension of Hunger (uncountable)
singular
indef.def.noun
nominativeeinderHunger
genitiveeinesdesHungers
dativeeinemdemHunger
accusativeeinendenHunger

Derived terms[edit]

  • hungrig

Related terms[edit]

  • Hungertuch, Hungersnot, Hungerwinter
  • Bärenhunger, Löwenhunger, Mordshunger

See also[edit]

  • Schmacht

Further reading[edit]

  • Hunger in Duden online

Low German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old Saxon hungar, from Proto-Germanic *hungruz. Compare High German Hunger, Dutch honger, English hunger, Swedish hunger.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈhʊŋːə(r)/

Noun[edit]

Hunger m (uncountable)

  1. hunger

Derived terms[edit]

  • Hungersnoot
  • hungerig / hungrig
